methods.name: mkdir
methods.detail: Create a new directory with optional permissions. Returns a Result type and on success will unwrap nil.

methods.name: access
methods.detail: Check user’s permissions for a file. Returns a Result type and on success will unwrap nil.

methods.name: rmdir
methods.detail: Remove directory. Returns a Result type and on success will unwrap nil.

methods.name: remove
methods.detail: Delete a file from filesystem. Returns a Result type and on success will unwrap nil.

methods.name: getpid
methods.detail: Returns the process ID (PID) of the calling process as a number. Note: Not available on windows.

methods.name: getppid
methods.detail: Returns the process ID of the parent of the calling process as a number. Note: Not available on windows.

methods.name: getuid
methods.detail: Returns the real user ID of the calling process as a number. Note: Not available on windows.

methods.name: geteuid
methods.detail: Returns the effective user ID of the calling process as a number. Note: Not available on windows.

methods.name: getgid
methods.detail: Returns the real group ID of the calling process as a number. Note: Not available on windows.

methods.name: getegid
methods.detail: Returns the effective group ID of the calling process as a number. Note: Not available on windows.

methods.name: getCWD
methods.detail: Get the current working directory of the Dictu process. Returns a Result type and on success will unwrap a string.

methods.name: setCWD
methods.detail: Set current working directory of the Dictu process. Returns a Result type and on success will unwrap a string.

methods.name: sleep
methods.detail: Sleep pauses execution of the program for a given amount of time in seconds.

methods.name: clock
methods.detail: Returns number of clock ticks since the start of the program as a number, useful for benchmarks.

methods.name: time
methods.detail: Returns UNIX timestamp as a number.

methods.name: collect
methods.detail: Manually trigger a garbage collection.

methods.name: exit
methods.detail: When you wish to prematurely exit the script with a given exit code.

methods.name: now
methods.detail: Returns a human readable locale datetime string.

methods.name: nowUTC
methods.detail: Returns a human readable UTC datetime string.

methods.name: strftime
methods.detail: Returns a user-defined datetime formatted string. Takes an optional argument which is a UNIX timestamp, so the date is formatted from the given timestamp rather than the current point in time.

methods.name: strptime
methods.detail: Returns the number of seconds from epoch. Note: This is not available on windows systems.

methods.name: min
methods.detail: Return the smallest number within the list or passed arguments.

methods.name: max
methods.detail: Return the largest number within the list or passed arguments.

methods.name: average
methods.detail: Return the average number within the list or passed arguments.

methods.name: sum
methods.detail: Return the sum of the list or passed arguments.

methods.name: floor
methods.detail: Return the largest integer less than or equal to the given input.

methods.name: round
methods.detail: Round to the nearest integer.

methods.name: ceil
methods.detail: Returns smallest integer greater than or equal to given input.

methods.name: abs
methods.detail: Returns absolute value of a given number.

methods.name: sqrt
methods.detail: Returns the square root of a given number.

methods.name: sin
methods.detail: Returns the sin value of a given number in radians.

methods.name: cos
methods.detail: Returns the cos value of a given number in radians.

methods.name: tan
methods.detail: Returns the tan value of a given number in radians.

methods.name: basename
methods.detail: Returns the basename of the path.

methods.name: dirname
methods.detail: Returns the directory name of the path.

methods.name: extname
methods.detail: Returns the extension portion of string, including the dot.

methods.name: isAbsolute
methods.detail: Returns true if path is absolute, false otherwise.

methods.name: realpath
methods.detail: Returns A Result type and unwraps the canonicalized absolute pathname as a string.

methods.name: exists
methods.detail: Returns a boolean whether a file exists at a given path.

methods.name: isDir
methods.detail: Checks whether a given path points to a directory or not. Note: This is not available on windows systems.

methods.name: listDir
methods.detail: Returns a list of strings containing the contents of the input path. Note: This function does not guarantee any ordering of the returned list.

methods.name: get
methods.detail: Get an environment variable. .get() will return a string if a valid environment variable is found otherwise nil.

methods.name: set
methods.detail: Change or add an environment variable. You can clear an environment variable by passing a nil value. When setting an environment variable the key must be a string and the value must be either a string or nil. Returns a Result type and on success will unwrap to nil.
methods.documentation:
Env.set('key', 'test');

Env.set('key', nil); // Remove env var

methods.name: parse
methods.detail: Parses a JSON string and turns it into a valid Dictu datatype. Returns a Result type and unwraps to datatype.

methods.name: stringify
methods.detail: Stringify converts a Dictu value into a valid JSON string. Returns a Result type and unwraps to string.

methods.name: get
methods.detail: Sends a HTTP GET request to a given URL. Timeout is given in seconds. Returns a Result and unwraps to a dictionary upon success.

methods.name: post
methods.detail: Sends a HTTP POST request to a given URL.Timeout is given in seconds. Returns a Result and unwraps to a dictionary upon success.

methods.name: create
methods.detail: Create a new socket object given a socket type and socket family. This will return a Result and unwrap to a new socket object in which the rest of the methods are ran on.

methods.name: random
methods.detail: Return a random decimal between 0 and 1.

methods.name: range
methods.detail: Returns a random integer between the lowest and highest inputs (both inclusive).

methods.name: select
methods.detail: Returns a value randomly selected from the list.

methods.name: encode
methods.detail: Base64 encode a given string.

methods.name: decode
methods.detail: Base64 decode a given string.

methods.name: sha256
methods.detail: Hashes a given string using the SHA-256 algorithm.

methods.name: hmac
methods.detail: Generate a HMAC using the SHA-256 algorithm. The raw optional argument determines whether the output will be in raw bytes or whether it will be in a string format, default is string format (false).

methods.name: bcrypt
methods.detail: Hashes a given string using the bcrypt algorithm. The rounds optional argument is the amount of rounds used to generate the hashed string, default is 8.

methods.name: bcryptVerify
methods.detail: This verifies a given bcrypt hash matches the plaintext input with a boolean return value. The comparison method used is timing safe.

methods.name: verify
methods.detail: Hashes a given string using the bcrypt algorithm. The rounds optional argument is the amount of rounds used to generate the hashed string, default is 8.Timing safe hash comparison. This should always be favoured over normal string comparison.

methods.name: exec
methods.detail:
Executing an external process can be done via .exec. Unlike .run() exec does not wait for the process to finish executing, so it is only useful for circumstances where you wish to “fire and forget”.

.exec() expects a list as a parameter which is the command and any arguments for the command as individual list elements, which all must be strings. It will return a Result that unwraps to nil on success.

methods.name: run
methods.detail:
Similar to .run() except this will wait for the external process to finish executing.

.run() expects a list as a parameter which is the command and any arguments for the command as individual list elements, and it will return a Result that unwraps to nil on success.

If the external process writes to stdout and you wish to capture the output you can pass an optional boolean argument to .run(), this will instead make the Result unwrap to a string of the captured output.

methods.name: connect
methods.detail:
This opens a connection to a SQLite database. Returns a Result type and on success wraps an abstract SQLite type.

Note: You can pass “:memory:” to open the SQLite database in memory rather than a file.

builtins.name: print
builtins.detail: Prints given values to the stdout

builtins.name: input
builtins.detail: Retrieves input from stdin and returns value as a string
builtins.documentation: input('Please enter your choice: '); // Optional prompt

builtins.name: type
builtins.detail: Returns the type of a given value as a string.

builtins.name: assert
builtins.detail: Raise a runtime error if the given expression is not truthy.

builtins.name: isDefined
builtins.detail: Returns a boolean depending on whether a variable has been defined in the global scope.
